newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Netscape EPS trimmed by H&Q.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Netscape EPS trimmed by H&Q.

text.p: Hambrecht & Quist analyst Daniel Rimer said he raised his 1997 revenue estimates for Netscape Communications Corp due to strong momentum going into the second half of 1997.
-- Analyst trimmed full-year earnings per share estimates to $0.47 from $0.52, saying he expects Netscape to reinvest more to build out infrastructure and to drive sales higher.
-- H&Q's revenue 1997 estimate increased to $560 million from $548 million previously.
-- Netscape shares off 2-3/4 to 41-3/4 in early trade.
-- Analyst leaves 1998 estimates of $0.88 a share earnings and $750 million in revenues intact, citing possible upside movement in the projections if company's momentum proceeds.
-- Netscape reported second quarter earnings per share of $0.10, in line with estimates, and revenues of $135.2 million, which were stronger than many analysts had expected.

-- Rimer said he raised revenue estimates to $145 million from $143 million in the September quarter and to $160 million from $156 million in the December quarter, while paring per share earnings to $0.12 from $0.14 in the third quarter and to $0.17 from $0.18 in the fourth quarter.
-- Rimer reiterated his "strong buy" rating on the stock.
